channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Bock gutter box in pavement, 7th November
item.description:
No 3 All Saints Road. We have had water ingress/flooding in the basement of this house. We have now had the gutter and down pipe cleaned out but water is still going down into the basement and fungus is now growing. Our contractor has been out to look at the black box gutter (pictured) but the section nearest the downpipe will remove the paving slab is moved and it is blocked causing water to keep running down the wall - this has been on going for 12 months we understand

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, All Saints' Road, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Somebody is reserving a parking space on public road with orange cones blocking the road with illegal cones, 7th November
item.description:
Outside dinglewell infants school GL33HS, two large orange cones in the road 9-2pm and from 3.30pm over night to 8.15 the next morning, a non resident is using cones in the road to save a space to park outside the school twice a day. Its public road and illegal to use cones to save a public space.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dinglewell, Hucclecote, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large crater, 7th November
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hyde Lane, Tewkesbury

item.title: Potholes still there despite saying fixed, 6th November
item.description:
There are a series of potholes as you drive up Birdlip hill. Drivers have the option of hitting oncoming traffic or hitting potholes with their left tyres. Previous report say they have been repaired, but this is not the case. These particular potholes are on and around the 40 mph road signs.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ermin Way, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large patch of repaired road breaking down again. 1 metre square?, 6th November
item.description:
Ref 6563686 A417 Corinium Avenue just before the bridge where lorries turn out. Reported on 7th Oct and I reported it again on Oct 21st as it was urgent. You emailed me that it had been repaired on Oct 25th. Travelling that way again last night I see that the repair is breaking down again. It must be the large lorries turning out onto the A417 at that point that are pulling up the tarmac. Please can you check again. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Corinium Avenue, Barnwood, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
